title: Problema colore in elenco posta in arrivo
content:
Buongiorno a tutti. Utilizzo Thunderbird sul mio Ubuntu ormai da anni, ma con le ultime due release principali ho un problema con il colore degli oggetti in uno solo dei miei account (sono due in tutto). Se utilizzo il tema "chiaro" tutto bene, se uso invece quello di sistema (o quello scuro) gli oggetti delle email mi restano neri e sono praticamente illeggibili. Questo solo su uno dei miei account. Vedi immagini: la prima è l'account che ha problemi, la seconda quello che invece funziona. Adesso ho disattivato il file userChrome.css, tanto non cambia nulla... Il file userChrome.css che avevo inserito nella precedente versione per risolvere, infatti, adesso non viene minimamente considerato, qualsiasi cosa io cambi. Ah, utilizzo la versione 115.2.3

Grazie1000 Stefano

title: Blank main screen after update Thunderbird
content:
We are deploying the latest Thunderbird updates (102.15.0 and 115.2.X for x86 versions), and in most workstations, after the update, the application stops displaying emails and remains with a blank main screen.

The computers already have configured email accounts in use, and since users do not have administrator permissions, the update is distributed through a third-party application that runs a script silently. This script copies the files locally and runs the command "Thunderbird Setup 115.2.2_x64.exe" /s /INI="thunderbird.ini."

In the "thunderbird.ini" file, the following is configured: [Install] QuickLaunchShortcut=false DesktopShortcut=false MaintenanceService=false StartMenuShortcuts=false PreventRebootRequired=false

In most cases, the issue has been resolved either by reinstalling a previous version of Thunderbird or by updating to the immediately higher available version.

Could you please help us identify what is causing this problem? Are we not using the correct method for deploying the updates?

Thank you very much!
creator: angel.sanchezb

title: Automatically move emails to dynamically created folders
content: Hello, is there a way to dynamically create folders depending on the recipient? Background: I normally use different emails for each login, but all have the same domain. If my domain is @ZZZ.com and I create an account here for firefox, the email is firefox@ZZZ.com. If it would be an account for amazon, it would be amazon@ZZZ.com and so on. On my mail server is a catch all for @ZZZ.com, that redirects the emails to one email account. I use that email Account for reading/managing all the incoming emails. In that main email account I would like to automatically sort emails depending on the prefix before @ZZZ.com. So if amazon sends me an email to amazon@ZZZ.com it should moved to a folder called amazon. If the email is from firefox, it should be moved to a folder called firefox. I could make folders by hand every single time when I create a new account, but that would be a lot of work. I would love to have a function/filter that I can click, that takes all emails and if the recipient has @ZZZ.com it checks the prefix and move it to the matching folder. If the folder doesnt exist yet, then create it and move the email. If there is a way to do it? With the default filter rules I cant find any way to do it. Maybe with a self written plugin?
creator: firefox2468

Al imprimirlo en blanco y negro, no tengo forma de saber a qué calendario pertenecen los eventos. ¿Cómo puedo imprimir los calendarios a color? He de decir que he probado en varios equipos (más de 5) y con versiones distintas de Thunderbird y con ninguna he podido imprimir ningún calendario a color. Para mí es muy necesario. Gracias.

title: Updating to Thunderbird 115 - s/Mime certificates
content:
I am starting to plan my upgrade from Thunderbird 52.9.1 to 115. 115 seems a little immature at present, so I'll be waiting until the new year before I do the upgrade but there are a lot of issues so I'll need the time to deal with those anyway.

I have 11 email accounts. Half of those have S/MIME certificates which I get from actalis.it. They are free and have to be renewed each year. Each year a new certificate is created and imported in to Thunderbird.

I use an add on called "security settings from address book" which allows me to automatically encrypt emails to recipients who have a flag set in the custom fields. This addon is not supported in Thunderbird 115, but I'm hoping the new certificate functions in 115 will work. I will not be using OpenPGP, Enigmail or GNUPG.

As each email address gets a new certificate each year I have to import each certificate to be able to access these older emails. So my question is this;

I assume if I don't import the certificates for each account for every year I will be unable to access the emails that were sent/received during the valid period of the related certificates - is that correct?

How will this affect people with whom I sent/received encrypted emails? Are they going to have to upgrade to 115 at the same time? I would have thought that as long as they have their certificates already installed in the same manner in which I had in my old Thunderbird they would not have to do anything?

Unrelated to encryption/digital signatures, I've just had a thought... Am I going to come across any issues pointing Thunderbird 115 to my existing mail folders?

I believe there is no "upgrade path". I have to do all of this from scratch?

I have about a 1,000 filters. Everything gets moved out of the inbox for the account into one or more folders on the Local Folders, where all of my mail folders reside. Can I copy the msgfilters.dat file for each account to the new installation and it will work? Or am I going to have to create all of the filters from scratch too?

thanks.
creator: citizen1138x

title: would like to change from new format to older format

Hello,

title: How do I automatically shut down Thunderbird?
content:
I leave Thunderbird permanently running as a tray icon in Windows 10, and I have an automatic overnight schedule to backup the profile that runs at the same time every day.

If I forget to close Thunderbird manually, I would like to automatically ensure it is fully closed before the backup runs, and I have been looking into ways of doing this.

AutoHotkey requires application windows to be open before closing them, and closing a tray icon seems to be much more complex. I also considered killing the thunderbird.exe process in Windows but this likely will end up in an unclean shutdown with possible data loss.

So what would be the best way for me to automatically ensure Thunderbird is cleanly shut down before the overnight profile backup runs?

creator: fivish

title: New version of thunderbird
content:
This is more a opinion than a question. The new version of TB stinks. Imagine being in a rush, opening your computer, only to discover your email is completely different. I was furious.

Software developers need to consider the following:

1) Just because you can, doesn't mean you should. 2) The "great new and improved" is fine for those who either developed it or for those who are knowledgeable enough to grasp it. That leaves out a lot of people. 3) The lack of an option to revert entirely is a big mistake. 4) The new layout is atrocious. 5) Lastly, I have never understood the need for two different forms of searching for previous email.

Just my thoughts.
creator: dougcarr

creator: rohe1318

title: Thunderbird does not remember the position within a folder
content:
Hello,

I noticed this since Thunderbird 115 (or thereabout). When I click on a folder I'd expect to be shown the messages I was looking last time. Let's say the folder A has a 100 messages and Thunderbird is showing me message 10 through 20. If I then click on another folder (B) and then click back to folder A, I'd expect to shown again message 10-20.

What happens instead is that Thunderbird shows (usually) the last 10 messages, 90 through 100. This happens as soon as you switch to B and back to A.

What's even more strange is what happens if I close Thunderbird. After starting Thunderbird and clicking on folder A, it will position itself randomly within the folder - let's say 50-60 (and sometimes it event manages to show the last position - seldomly). As above I'd expect it to show the messages I was watching last. If at least it would always do the same - go to the end, for example. You can imagine this is very annoying as each time I open a folder, I have to scroll to the bottom to see the new message (I use filters to put messages in the correct folder).

OS is: ``` Linux c 6.4.16-1-MANJARO #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Wed Sep 13 12:21:42 UTC 2023 x86_64 GNU/Linux ```

Thunderbird 115.2.2 / SUPERNOVA / Mozilla Thunderbird for Manjaro Linux

Additonal info: using POP3.

title: Thunderbird's Alerts Steal Focus from Full Screen Games
content:
Thunderbird recently updated from 102 to 115. Now when in games using full screen windowed mode, the new mail alert pops up over the game, where it never used to do that. If I'm in an exclusive full screen game, the alert causes the game to lose focus, which again, never happened in 102.

The calendar alerts sometimes steal focus in either full screen mode, but sometimes not. It seems entirely random. This is not new to 115, but it's still annoying. I can be in the same game, hear the notification and not lose focus. Other times, even in the same game, the notification steals the game's focus.

I checked the settings, they are the same as before. I prefer Thunderbird's notification over the system notification style, but it doesn't seem to obey the system's focus assist rules.
